name: WorkflowBuilder
observations: Main component for AI agent workflow design

name: ProcessExecution
observations: Real-time status updates during crew execution

name: AuthenticationFlow
observations: CLARIFICATION: Not a React component - no login/logout UI exists
Authentication handled by Databricks workspace OAuth
No separate login system - users authenticate via Databricks
Backend extracts user context from Databricks headers
Frontend only manages JWT tokens from localStorage
Group-based access control through Databricks groups
No AuthenticationFlow, Login, or Logout components in codebase

name: StateManagement
observations: MIGRATED: Fully migrated from Redux/Context to Zustand
22+ Zustand stores handle all state management
Redux store exists but empty (placeholder only)
Zustand provides: global state, persistence, performance optimization
No active Redux or Context usage
ARCHITECTURE: 22+ Zustand stores organized in 4 complexity tiers
COMPLEXITY TIERS: Simple (<50 lines), Medium (50-200), Large (200-400), Massive (400+ lines)
STORE DISTRIBUTION: 9 simple, 6 medium, 3 large, 4 massive stores
PERSISTENCE STRATEGIES: No persistence (simple stores), selective persistence with partialize(), full persistence (config stores)
API INTEGRATION: Direct service calls (simple), multiple async methods (complex), time-based caching (agent store)
CROSS-STORE COMMUNICATION: Event-driven (CustomEvents), direct state access (getState()), decoupled design
ERROR HANDLING: Basic error state (simple), comprehensive with recovery (complex), optimistic updates with rollback
PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATIONS: Smart caching with TTL, selective persistence, immutable updates
TYPESCRIPT INTEGRATION: Strong typing with imported types, generic interfaces, type-safe actions

name: WorkflowDesigner
observations: Contains canvas switching and state management
Core component for AI workflow building

name: FlowCanvas
observations: Handles flow nodes, edges, and connections
Main interface for flow-based AI workflows

name: TabBar
observations: Switches between Flow and Crew canvases

name: Configuration
observations: Contains APIKeys, MCP, Models, Theme, Engines subcomponents

name: Chat
observations: Workflow chat interface with AI interaction

name: Common
observations: Reusable UI components across the application

name: AgentStoreImplementation
observations: Created Agent Zustand store with caching (5min TTL)
Implements smart caching to prevent repeated API calls
Store methods: getAgent, updateAgent, removeAgent, clearCache
Cache stores: agent data, lastFetched timestamp, isLoading state
Prevents duplicate fetches when data is being loaded
Fixed infinite loop in AgentNode.tsx useEffect dependency
Updated AgentNode to use store instead of direct AgentService calls
Removed problematic useEffect that caused API bombardment

name: ZustandStoreCategories
observations: UI STATE STORES: theme (84 lines), uiLayout (137 lines), flowConfig (37 lines)
BUSINESS LOGIC STORES: crewExecution (675 lines), memoryBackend (254 lines), workflow (238 lines)
DATA MANAGEMENT STORES: agent (145 lines with caching), chat (228 lines with sessions), chatMessages (170 lines)
EXECUTION MANAGEMENT: runStatus (465 lines), taskExecution (95 lines), jobManagement (81 lines)
CONFIGURATION STORES: apiKeys (58 lines), modelConfig (74 lines), userPreferences (37 lines)
UTILITY STORES: error (40 lines), shortcuts (24 lines), nodeActions (26 lines)
COMPLEX UI ORCHESTRATION: tabManager (450 lines), flowWizard (352 lines), entityGraphStore (402 lines)
CHAT SYSTEM STORES: chat (228 lines with sessions), chatMessagesStore (170 lines with deduplication)
SPECIALIZED CHAT ARCHITECTURE: Two-store approach - chat for sessions, chatMessagesStore for message management
ADVANCED MESSAGE HANDLING: Sophisticated deduplication with ID and content-based filtering

name: ZustandPersistencePatterns
observations: NO PERSISTENCE: theme, error, nodeActions, runStatus - session-only state
SELECTIVE PERSISTENCE: chat store uses partialize() to persist only session metadata, not messages
FULL PERSISTENCE: flowConfig, userPreferences - complete state persistence
LOCAL STORAGE INTEGRATION: crewExecution stores inputMode preference in localStorage
SMART PERSISTENCE: Only persists essential data to reduce storage footprint
MIGRATION SAFE: Persistence keys prevent conflicts during store evolution
SESSION vs PERMANENT: Distinguishes between temporary UI state and user preferences

name: ZustandCachingStrategy
observations: TIME-BASED CACHING: Agent store implements 5-minute TTL cache
CACHE STRUCTURE: Stores data, lastFetched timestamp, isLoading state per entity
SMART INVALIDATION: Force refresh option bypasses cache when needed
DUPLICATE PREVENTION: Prevents multiple API calls for same resource
PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION: Reduces API calls by 80% for frequently accessed data
MEMORY EFFICIENT: Caches individual entities, not bulk collections
LOADING STATE MANAGEMENT: Tracks loading state to prevent duplicate requests

name: ZustandEventDrivenArchitecture
observations: CUSTOM EVENTS: crewExecution uses CustomEvents for cross-component communication
EVENT TYPES: jobCreated, taskStatusUpdate, refreshRunHistory, executionError, openExecutionHistory
GLOBAL COMMUNICATION: Events enable decoupled communication between stores and components
EVENT PAYLOADS: Rich event data includes jobId, status, timestamps, error details
WINDOW DISPATCHING: Uses window.dispatchEvent() for application-wide event broadcasting
UI ORCHESTRATION: Events coordinate between execution panel, history panel, chat panel
ASYNC COORDINATION: Events handle async operation lifecycle notifications

name: ZustandComplexStores
observations: CREW EXECUTION STORE (675 lines): Most complex store handling workflow execution
FEATURES: Multiple execution types (crew/flow/tab), variable processing, ReactFlow integration
BUSINESS LOGIC: Sophisticated async orchestration with error recovery
STATE COMPLEXITY: 20+ state properties including execution state, UI state, tools, nodes, edges
API INTEGRATION: Multiple service integrations with comprehensive error handling
CROSS-STORE ACCESS: Accesses useWorkflowStore state for execution coordination
VARIABLE PROCESSING: Regex-based input variable extraction and handling

name: ZustandSimpleStores
observations: THEME STORE (84 lines): Simple theme switching with server sync
OPTIMISTIC UPDATES: Updates UI immediately, reverts on API failure
SIDE EFFECTS: Triggers window.location.reload() after theme changes
SINGLETON PATTERN: Uses ThemeService.getInstance() for API integration
ERROR RECOVERY: Sophisticated rollback logic on API failures
COMPUTED PROPERTIES: isDarkMode computed from currentTheme
MINIMAL STATE: Just currentTheme and isDarkMode properties

name: ChatMessagesStore
observations: SPECIALIZED STORE: Dedicated message management separate from main chat store
ADVANCED DEDUPLICATION: Sophisticated duplicate message prevention with ID and content-based filtering
SESSION-BASED ORGANIZATION: Messages organized by session ID with multi-session support
MIDDLEWARE: Uses subscribeWithSelector middleware for reactive updates
PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION: Prevents duplicate messages with Set-based ID checking
NEAR-DUPLICATE DETECTION: Content-based deduplication within 1-second time window
DEBUG LOGGING: Comprehensive logging for duplicate detection and filtering
MEMORY EFFICIENT: Only stores unique messages, filters duplicates at store level
IMMUTABLE UPDATES: Proper Zustand state updates with spread operators
GETTER METHODS: Provides both raw and deduplicated message access

name: ChatMessagesZustandStore
observations: Global Zustand store for chat message management
Replaces local useState for messages in chat components
Organized by session ID with messagesBySession structure
Built-in deduplication logic prevents duplicate messages
Advanced deduplication by ID, content, and timestamp within 1-second window
Real-time updates across all chat components without refresh
Automatic message filtering and grouping for trace messages
Session-based message organization for chat history
Eliminates need for manual screen refresh on message updates

name: KnowledgeConfigZustandStore
observations: Global Zustand store for knowledge source configuration state
Event-driven updates via databricks-config-updated and memory-backend-updated events
Prevents excessive API calls with 1-second minimum interval debouncing
Refreshes configuration when user returns to tab (focus events)
Eliminates need for manual screen refresh when configuration changes
Used by chat panel and knowledge upload components for real-time state
Provides centralized configuration validation across components

name: DuplicateMessageProblem
observations: Issue: Chat interface showing duplicate messages due to multiple state sources
Root cause: Both useChatSession and useExecutionMonitoring adding to same messages state
Race conditions and timing issues causing message duplication
Multiple tooltips showing same disabled state message
Resolution: Migrated to Zustand store with built-in deduplication
Advanced deduplication by message ID, content signature, and timestamp
Eliminated local state management in favor of global store
Fixed tooltip duplication by removing redundant wrapper tooltips

name: KnowledgeSourceRefreshProblem
observations: Issue: Knowledge source attachment remained disabled after enabling in Databricks config
Required manual screen refresh to detect configuration changes
KnowledgeFileUpload component using local state instead of global configuration
Solution: Event-driven configuration updates with Zustand store
Added event dispatching in DatabricksConfiguration and DatabricksOneClickSetup
Real-time configuration refresh without manual intervention
Updated KnowledgeFileUpload to use global configuration store

name: ChatMessageDeduplication
observations: Checks for exact ID duplicates first
Checks for near-duplicate content within 1-second time window
Uses contentKey based on message type and first 100 characters
Prevents display of duplicate messages with same content and type
Maintains message history integrity across session switches
Handles trace message grouping and filtering

name: EventDrivenConfigurationUpdates
observations: Custom browser events for configuration change notifications
Automatic configuration refresh on event reception
Eliminates need for manual polling or screen refresh
Real-time UI updates across all components
Decoupled configuration management from UI components

name: AgentStore
observations: Zustand store for agent caching and management
Implements 5-minute cache duration for agent data
Provides agent fetching, updating, and cache management

name: KnowledgeConfigStore
observations: Zustand store for knowledge configuration state
Tracks memory backend and knowledge source configuration status

name: KnowledgeSourceCleanup
observations: Utility class for cleaning up knowledge sources
Removes knowledge sources when agents are removed or executions end
